Reviews.Title: Seems perfect for now
Reviews.Author: goodrear
Reviews.Content: I ordered this laptop on Thursday and just in 1 day, it was delivered in a perfect condition. Didn't have the chance to see every feature, but I can say that I loved this PC at first sight.. Looks so solid, not like some others giving you a feeling that they will break down if you don't be very careful. Only problem for now seems to be the touch pad. I can say that its little bit sticky, hard to move the cursor precisely.. Also, left and right click buttons are really hard to press. Clicking means really clicking for this laptop !!! Don't hesitate to buy, perfect item for its price. But make sure you order a nice mice too..Now, after using the PC for a few days, I m happy to see that the touch pad buttons are getting easier to press. Finger print reader and Hp Simple Pass application that allows you to use your fingerprint instead of entering usernames and passwords works very well. Swipe your finger once and all the websites you enrolled in fingerprint system shows up. Swipe it once more, you are logged on in seconds. No Username No Password..

Reviews.Title: Great laptop at a Great price point..
Reviews.Author: OldGeek
Reviews.Content: I looked at many of the reviews and most complained about the amount of bloatWare on the computer and this is true. I removed many including Norton. Try AVG free for anti-virus, search google you will find it.Also, some want just the Windows 7 OS! This is easily done by pressing the F11 key during boot up. You will then go into the Recovery console and choose the one on the left that says "Minimal Install". After you reboot the only thing on the laptop will be the Windows 7 premium (64bit) OS and I checked in device manager and everything is working!As noted above the F11 key that kicks off the HP recovery console is a very nice feature but another is the one built into Windows 7 called "Backup" (type in Backup in the search when in Windows). Choose to create a "System Image" and have a portable USB/eSata hdd ready. You can then save the image to that drive in case of disaster. At the end of the System Image creation make sure you create the System Repair CD. The System Repair CD will be used to restore the "System Image" if you ever need to. This is very usefull after you get the laptop loaded and customized with all the software that you want.The touch pad, don't be so quick to judge. Look in the control panel for the touchpad control and try a few different options. The all-in-one touchpad works fine for me.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware - Repair Limitations
Reviews.Author: Tias "Tias"
Reviews.Content: Buyer Beware.  I purchased a HP Pavilion laptop with a Windows 7 Professional operating system in March 2010. The hard drive crashed while the system was under warranty in September 2010.  I discovered the external Seagate backup drive performed a selective backup instead of a complete backup, backing up only 18 GB out of 200 GB of data. According to one computer repair technician, many of the files were still readable on the defective HP drive. I then decided to replace the hard drive myself at my cost and reload the OS, only to learn that HP "tatoos" their drives preventing anyone from replacing the drive with anything other than the exact same drive from HP. Without the tatoo, I could not reload my operating system which came from HP. HP quoted me a price over $300 for the HP replacement "tatooed? hard drive.  Identical drives without the tatoo cost approximately 1/3 the price of the HP drive. As I had already purchased a hard drive from a local "big chain" computer repair shop, I decided to obtain a new copy of Windows 7 Professional and just reload the operating system. Again, I learned that this also does not work. HP informed me that they would give me a replacement hard drive only after I gave them my original hard drive.  Since I first needed a computer with the Windows 7 operating system installed to transfer the recoverable data files from the bad drive to a good drive and then to securely erase data on the the old drive, this was not an acceptable option. HP tech support failed miserably during this process since the HP technician (who had a heavy India English accent) told me that I had to go back to the computer store where I purchased the hard drive and have them fix the system. It took four weeks for me to discover that ONLY HP could fix the laptop. I did take the laptop back to the place of purchase.  They experienced the same problem in attempting to get HP to fix the laptop. The computer has been broken now for seven weeks. While the HP laptop operated okay (not great, just OK) when it worked, I discovered that HP laptops are simply no longer repairable unless you bite the bullet and allow HP to make the repairs at an incredibly high price. In reviewing prior laptop purchases, I realized that ALL of my prior HP laptops had broken after a year or so and that the other brands of laptops I purchased - while old and banged up from use - continued to operate. It does not make sense: why would a company (HP) which brags that it is a "green" company produce disposable laptops whose users will throw them away into the dumpster when they break and when they learn they are not economical to upgrade or repair.

Reviews.Title: HP Pavilion dv6 series laptop
Reviews.Author: p. fossier "pfossier"
Reviews.Content: You be the judge:Bought an HP Pavilion dv6 series notebook new from Best Buy on 11/01/09.Repair history:HD died and was replaced on 03/22/10.HD died and was replaced on 05/24/10.Integrated mouse broke 08/22/10HD died 11/12/10 - parts and laptop are out of warrantyReplacement parts have a 90 days warranty.Tech support in India is not allowed to connect me to a manageror refer me back to a customer support department in the US.They do want me to sign up for extended care for another $200/yearbut even if it were free - who would want to go through this type ofordeal.  Every support call takes between 60 and 90mns.

Reviews.Title: I don't like it
Reviews.Author: Vicky
Reviews.Content: I just got this laptop as a gift. It looks very cool and it is very thin. I so want to keep it but the track pad is driving me crazy. It is very hard to use and it's already causing me finger pain on my second day. The cursor jumps around as I am typing on the keyboard, but when I do need to use the track pad to scroll up and down, it is half dead. Very very frustrating to use. Another thing I hate about this laptop is the monitor. The colors appear strangely purplish and it is nearly impossible to see details if the colors are light. For example, it is impossible to see a lace pattern on the screen. I went through color calibration but it didn't help. It hurts my eyes to stare at the screen.

Reviews.Title: HP Review
Reviews.Author: uni_allen7
Reviews.Content: This laptop is actually one of the best laptops I have ever used or owned. I was very afraid it might have some flaws when reading the reviews for it but so far I have had no problems with it what so ever. This is a great friendly laptop that will definitely meet all your requirements. I would give this more stars if possible. The keyboard is amazing, the battery life is amazing, and the overall performance of the windows system formatted on here is perfect.The only thing I do not like about this laptop is the sensitivity of the mouse touch pad. It is hardly sensitive and with other laptops you can scroll down the page with one finger and here you have to use two. It also has the ability to stretch and shrink pages on the touch pad and that can become very annoying when typing or scrolling online.

Reviews.Title: great now but shaky start
Reviews.Author: J. Popp
Reviews.Content: when i fist got it, the disc drive didnt work.spent hours with tech support, had no idea what they were saying. didnt fix the problem.fixed itself after a couple of days and havent had any trouble since.So far, i love the machine and other than that speed bump at the beginning, im pretty satisfied with it.

Reviews.Title: Great products at a mind-boggling price!
Reviews.Author: TonyG
Reviews.Content: I bought this exact laptop on August 2010 for $700 and thought i had gotten a great deal. For $525, this machine is a steal. The speed is great, it is practical, portable, bright, sharp and hasn't given me any problems whatsoever. In fact i love it so much i now only buy my electronic products from hp if possible. Great laptop for a college student or anyone who wants a durable, well-made, well-run laptop that gets the job done for a superb price!

Reviews.Title: Don't get sucked in by it's great looks and attractive price
Reviews.Author: AutumnRowan
Reviews.Content: I bought a DV series laptop to use with streaming media and for the first six months it was great. Then it started hanging up during the boot. In the last sixteen weeks it's been in for repair three times and the motherboard has been replaced twice. This time they're replacing the RAM and the proc too. HP sold me a piece of junk and now they're trying to sell me an extended warranty to cover their faulty equipment. Check online- there are many documented cases of DV series motherboard problems as well as HP's poor warranty service and non-existant customer service!! If you don't want to repair your laptop every six weeks, look at a different brand!UPDATE: HP finally replaced my laptop after eight weeks and two calls from the state Attorney General's Office of Consumer Affairs HOWEVER they replaced my $800 custom build with a $500 off the shelf version. (It's worth noting that stopped manufacturing that model a mere ten months after they introduced it.) The replacement laptop is still functioning pretty well a year later (the fan does weird things, constantly cycling on and off but I can live with that).  I still will not be buying any more HP products unless I can live without warranty coverage.

Reviews.Title: I love this laptop.
Reviews.Author: Mohammed F. Makia
Reviews.Content: I used the free shipping option and I received the laptop next day, I love this laptop, lots of new fetures, everything is great except the touch pad buttons but not a big deal, i like the fingerprint reader, make login to websites much easier, no more typing user name and password.

Reviews.Title: Always had problems
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Roberts
Reviews.Content: I purchased this computer for my husband as a replacement for my 12 year old Toshiba.  After 18 months of very light use, the screen went black and the computer would not boot up.  I ended up replacing the CPU and purchasing a replacement battery since the battery went bad at the same time.  Less than 3 months after the new CPU was put in the same symptoms appeared again.  Now a second CPU and a fan (since we learned this model gets hot) and still not working.  Now I am told I need a new motherboard.  I am now giving up on repair.  I will not be purchasing another HP.

Reviews.Title: good product
Reviews.Author: cynical38. "cynical38"
Reviews.Content: This laptop works great but windows 7 is a pain at times -- I may upgrade ?? to windows 8 but this ole feller (75) prefers to stick with what I know --windows 7 I have a feeling that it was returned and refurbished because of a sound problem that it still has because the headset plug has to be wiggled a bit to get good contact.

Reviews.Title: Fan failure
Reviews.Author: Worthington's Law
Reviews.Content: The fan failed after two years of ownership. I know it's too late for anyone to care, but this was the laptop that finally motivated me to buy a MacBook. Well worth the extra money.

Reviews.Title: Yet another troublesome HP laptop
Reviews.Author: Christine CaliGirl
Reviews.Content: I have bought three HP laptops since 2006 -- I'd have thought I'd learned my lesson by now. Each had hardware problems of some sort, not to mention the bloatware and the maddening touchpad. This one started giving me problems soon after Costco's six month, no-questions-asked return policy expired. Twice the system went into a BSOD-type failure and could only be restored by doing a total system recovery, wiping out all of my data and installed software. Thank God some jerk actually just stole my last HP laptop from me at a convention in Atlanta; it's an excuse to replace the laptop with a more reliable manufacturer's model. The problem is that the HP brand has gone downhill ever since HP acquired Compaq, so you just can't trust their laptops any longer.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Raymondcr "Raymondcr"
Reviews.Content: I definetly love this brand and product... I bought it last Xmas on Black Friday / Cyber Monday and have no complain. Products works like a charm... Im a system engineer and this unit does what it suppose to do and a bit more... Next upgrade I do will be on same brand / model maybe DV-7...

Reviews.Title: Great laptop for those wanting a normal size
Reviews.Author: AMN3Z1A
Reviews.Content: Bought this for myself to replace an aging laptop I had for years. Worked great for travelling and simple gaming. Bought another laptop for girlfriend on her birthday, she wanted one with a larger screen, so she got what she wanted. This laptop outperforms the one she wanted, so now she uses this one and the one I got for her is acting DVR with a TV tuner hooked to it. Upgraded this laptop to 8GB RAM and it works wonderful as a gaming laptop. Onboard graphics performs well under gaming conditions, better than the 2.3 dual core I bought for her. Got a great deal on this laptop, especially since the box store wanted well over $700. for the exact same one.

Reviews.Title: I am very much dissatisfied
Reviews.Author: hhimam
Reviews.Content: This laptop came to me with defect in CD ROM drive. the backside opened before. I am very much dissatisfied

Reviews.Title: favorite
Reviews.Author: katelittle
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite comptuer. I got this laptop a year ago or so, and it's worked extremely well.  All the specs are good for the price, but what you're really getting is the aesthetic, polished feel of the keyboard and monitor.  This computer is a pleasure to use because HP paid attention to the tactile.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: thefunnyman
Reviews.Content: First of all, I work in IT and I've had this laptop since Thanksgiving 2010.  I've gotten plenty of use out of this machine in that time and these are my thoughts.The first thing you must do to get the optimal experience from this device is to remove every bit of HP bloatware installed on the machine.  This is VERY important.  Most if not all of it can be removed as each HP bundled application is a fancy interface for something windows already provides, such as an application to interface with your wireless adapter.  I got rid of everything except the support interface that automagically checks for new drivers.  If this is not done, you cannot make a reliable comparison between this machine and a similarly specc'd machine from a different company.  Removing the hp bloatware will also help to increase your battery life as well.With that said, after removing hp's stuffs, this machine performs like a champ.  I can run virtual machines while doing development work and compiles happen quickly.  I haven't had the greatest experience getting all hardware to work with linux-based distributions, so I've pretty much stuck with Windows 7 as my primary OS.  Touchpad drivers in linux (synaptics) are spotty with support at best.For those making comments about the machine getting hot, here's the reason.  The fan intake is on the bottom of the machine.  If I block the fan input by putting the machine on a soft surface, it can get hot.  This is my number one complaint with this machine is the placement of the fan intake.  If it is placed on a hard surface, I see no such issues with heat.  Don't lay this device on a pillow and expect it NOT to get hot though, that would be unrealistic.I don't do any PC gaming (console gaming mostly), so the less-than-stellar graphics hardware was not and is still not a concern for me.  The graphics hardware as-is will play HD video very well, which is the only requirement I actually have.All in all, this was the perfect device for my needs and I got it on sale at $550!  This is definitely a superb budget development machine with lots of ports for different components.  If you want to properly care for this device, you have to be mindful of the fan intake and ensure proper ventilation.  My teenage sister has killed 2 machines (from different manufacturers) by not allowing proper ventilation.Other random cons:No keyboard backlighting2 hour-ish battery lifeI hope this review will help others make an informed decision.

Reviews.Title: Solid laptop...but!!!!
Reviews.Author: Chris O "Contrarian"
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty solid laptop and I can't add much more to what any of the others who have reviewed this before me have said.Really, I have only one minor negative and one really major negative which is just now cropping up.The minor:  I hate, hate, HATE the power cable/input.  It's a giant and stiff thing jutting out from the side of the computer.  I know from experience that I'll end up beating it up until the power jack inside the laptop ends up breaking.  I've done it with several other laptops in my life, and this one will be worse than most.  At least it's not on the rear of the computer.  Those go quickly.  Yes, I'm rough on my equipment but I really wish manufacturers would give this issue a little more thought.  If you're really careful with it, you won't have any problem other than two inches worth of power plug sitting there on the side of your laptop.The major:  You should be aware that if you're buying this for the fingerprint reader, it's not going to work for you if you've upgraded your browsers (Firefox 4, IE9), and it doesn't work at all in Chrome.  To add insult to injury, the manufacturer (Digital Personas) has ceased support for this scanner to concentrate more corporate things and less on the consumer market.  The scanner was a deciding factor in my purchase of this laptop over some other models, so I'm pretty irritated.  There may be some third party support in the form of plugins or whatnot later, but that doesn't make me any happier.  The scanner still works and still manages passwords, but it will not auto-fill website logins when using these newer browsers and this was its primary reason for existing.  You can still use it to unlock your computer and do some other minor things, but if you're going to use it to make your web experience better, forget about it.Other than that, this is a solid, if unspectacular, laptop.  At the price Amazon is charging for this now (I got this for two hundred dollars cheaper from Amazon 6 months ago...wth?), there are probably better options.  Especially if you take out the now nearly useless fingerprint reader.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good
Reviews.Author: Richard L Carpenter, Jr
Reviews.Content: Have had the computer for a month and it is working well. The mousepad is a drawback. Tapping is difficult - you have to tap just right or it ignores it. And the left/right mouse buttons are very difficult to use. This makes dragging especially difficult. This is after experimenting with the control panel settings. Also, we get a bit under 3 hours of battery life with light use. Otherwise, it seems to be a solid and reliable computer.

Reviews.Title: Great item!
Reviews.Author: Jay Bhatt "Jay"
Reviews.Content: This laptop is great. There is only one con that I can think of and that would be the lack of a lit-up screen. Otherwise, it's a great buy and would highly recommend for all.

Reviews.Title: This laptop has a $1000 quality
Reviews.Author: Gitthew
Reviews.Content: I had only a few hours to order a laptop, so I had to determine the best option in a short time period. My mother already had an HP Dm4, which is very similar to this model. Because her laptop was extremely efficient and had a good quality, i decided to go with this model, which is cheaper in price but stuffed with better features. I must say, IM IMPRESSED. The windows 7 works seamlessly with the hardware to make a great experience. Just so you know, youll want to clean off most of HP's preinstalled garbage; after doing so, the performance of the laptop will significantly increase. This is a must buy laptop, amd at almost $600, kicks plasticky Toshibas and Acers out of the water. A sturdy, metal, powerhouse: a GREAT purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great Computer
Reviews.Author: Edwin H. Holmes Jr. "ehh2"
Reviews.Content: I have had this computer for about a week now.  I cleaned off all of the junk software.  I removed Norton and added Avast.  I removed the 60-day trial of Office 2007 and added Office 2010.  I set up the wireless connection and I was ready to go.  I love this computer in every way.  It is fast, it is beautiful, and it works great.  It is a great buy.

Reviews.Title: BEst bang for buck out their!
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedCompUser
Reviews.Content: Ok this laptop is more than enough for media and small time gaming. The price ($525) cannot be surpassed in terms of quality to price ration. This laptops aluminum yet simple finish is great and looks classy. The mouse pad is a little hard to click but you will get used to it. The only real problem ( But still minor) is that it seems to have a driver issue with the audio when connected to external speakers. The defect only last a second though and doesnt repeat. Im sure there is an update to be downloaded to fix the issue.

Reviews.Title: HP computers have poor reliability
Reviews.Author: Gary "Gary"
Reviews.Content: I bought  a sister version of this computer, the DV6-33010us.  You can see my review under that model.  However, since that was my third lemon from HP in five years, I have since done more research and I suggest that anyone who plans to buy a HP do their own research.  Look at the reviews for any three HP models.  What you are likely to find is that a significant minority of buyers have had major problems with their purchases. For a more comprehensive analysis look at SquareTrade, the company that provides warranties for Amazon.  It rates HP  last in reliability for the eight major brands it rates.  HP computers have a 25 percent failure rate within three years, worse than Dell, Acer and Gateway. (ASUS and Toshiba have the best ratings)  No major company should allow a such failure rate on their products. As consumers we should insist they do better before we buy their products.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop!!
Reviews.Author: S. SMITH
Reviews.Content: Bought this laptop for our eldest who is in college and she absolutely loves it.  Wished we would have bought two of them!  The only thing to keep in mind is it does not come with a full version of Office - only a trial so you'll need to get a key from Microsoft for the full version which will run you about $150.00 for the Home Office and Student version.  Still a great buy!

Reviews.Title: Awful input.  Do not buy.
Reviews.Author: Christopher R. Bush
Reviews.Content: The boss found these on special and got 3 for the office, and I got one.  I hate it SO MUCH! The trackpad is absolutely awful - extremely temperamental, fails to register clicks very frequently.  Additionally, the keyboard has these extra keys along the left side.  They open your email, web browser, the "hp media center", the calculator, or the print dialog.  They are pointless and extremely easy to accidentally hit, so you bring up the calculator in the middle of typing an email, for example.  Additionally, while you can remap most of the keys using hacks, you can't remap the print key without remapping the "P" key also.  Idiotic design.  Did HP's engineers ever use this?  They should be sentenced to using nothing but this machine for the next year.It's fine when using an external mouse & keyboard.  But IT'S A FRIGGIN' LAPTOP IT SHOULD BE USABLE ON MY DAMN LAP!!!

Reviews.Title: HP quality and customer service is horrible
Reviews.Author: Glenn Luck
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Pavillion. Just a few months after the 1 year warranty expired the video card went out.  The problem was related to a faulty solder that could not withstand higher temperatures.  Despite the fact that the solder was defective, they said they would only fix the problem if I paid $500.  Thanks a lot HP.

Reviews.Title: HP has poor customer service
Reviews.Author: gettysburg
Reviews.Content: We bought an HP laptop last year for our daughter while attending Penn State at Christmas time.  When she got to school in the fall her laptop would not work at Penn State.  Many calls back and forth with HP and nothing was ever resolved.  Some HP laptops are not compatable with Penn States Server.  We ended up buying a Dell and had no problems.  HP said their was nothing wrong with their laptop that is was a problem with Penn States Server.  We requested a replacement from HP of a laptop that would be compatible with Penn States Server and nothing was ever resolved.  We ended up being out $600 for a worthless laptop. Anyway, if you buy a laptop for a college student, be careful. Or better yet, buy another brand. We will never purchase an HP product ever again.
